definition: to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: I brush some potato-chip crumbs off my lap.
sentences.chinese: 我把薯片屑從我大腿上擦掉。

sentences.english: Please wipe excess oil from engine nacelles and landing gears.
sentences.chinese: 擦掉髮動機吊艙和起落架上多餘的油。

sentences.english: He wiped the scribbling off the blackboard.
sentences.chinese: 他把黑板上亂塗亂劃的東西擦掉了。

sentences.english: Wipe off these scribblings from the blackboard.
He dusted every bit of dirt off his furniture.
sentences.chinese: 他把傢俱上的污物都擦掉了。

sentences.english: The words and drawings sponged off yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 牆上的字和畫昨天被擦掉了。

sentences.english: Plaese wipe the words off the blackboard.
let's remind ourselves of what I just erased.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們提醒一下自己剛纔我擦掉的內容。

sentences.english: The writing on the board has been rubbed off .
sentences.chinese: 那塊板上的字跡已被擦掉了。

sentences.english: This may necessitate touching up your eye shadow a bit.
sentences.chinese: 不過，必不可免地也會擦掉一點眼影。

sentences.english: Apply it with a clean, lint-free cloth and wipe away the excess.
sentences.chinese: 使用清潔的無塵布塗上去，然後再把多餘的部分擦掉。

sentences.english: Then he wiped blood on his thumb away. The queen stood on the threshold, shocked.
sentences.chinese: 然後他擦掉拇指上的血跡，王后震驚的站在門檻上。

sentences.english: Make light pencil lines so that they will erase easily.
sentences.chinese: 鉛筆線劃得淡些，以便容易擦掉。

sentences.english: Let me copy it because I will have to erase at some point.
sentences.chinese: 先抄寫過來，過會得擦掉。

sentences.english: He removed the cucumber slices and sponged off the coating.
sentences.chinese: 他揭下了黃瓜片並用海綿擦掉敷面。

definition: to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
to apply (ointment, powder)/to smear/to paint on
water spot/water stain/wet spot/damp patch/water damage
